post.body: lol--I agree w/your sentiment re: Mac TV--I don't really care if it's mac tv, amazon or iTunes store...I personally prefer no media
I agree!! Just pay for internet...no cable or phone bill! :D
I got my fireplace from http://iyule.tv/ :P
Well, now that's a good question, but you may have hit on a new product idea (if no such thing exists)...I'm sure U're not the only
Have you tried amazon.com/ondemand ? I like how there is no media to deal with. :)
Now you know Sony invented bluray..why'd you go and get you a Sharp?!
Maybe you can offset the tone by using translucent films (available in different shades) wrapped around the bulb? I dunno... :P
lol...hadn't heard of 'tweethearts' before. Cute!
I think everyone has a different capacity to give and help. More important to me is that people find an outlet 4 doing good.
Yeah I know what you mean, but w/2 kids and a wife I am more than busy w/facetime relations :P I don't mind the middleman.
I don't think that the lower 90% can get there by themselves because there is a HUGE force weighing them down...need awakening.
their assault on humanity and all that is decent.
The only problem is that while the lower 90% are trying to make the best of things and help where they can the top 10% maintain
I have "profited" more by donating to worthy causes than I have ever made putting the money in stocks. Yin/Yang, Karma=real.
I really wonder sometimes about some brands....if they really even know the meaning of 'equity'. :/
Yes they did, and it's one of the first things you quietly learn at design school, as you pay your $10,000 quarterly tuition
God, that Nike Swoosh story has got to be the worst bit of PR ever for any/all designers. :P Lesson: Screw the designers.
Worst part about squishies is having to sit down and drink...I hate that part. :/
And the water fountain adds a nice ambiance to our place...great purchase all around, and an early Xmas present for the poor kittie.
Purchased a Drinkwell pet fountain (made by http://www.vetventures.com/) yesterday and my cat LOVES it. She doesn't make a water mess nemore
http://change.gov/ reports 31 days until the inauguration. Seriously...can it go any slower? lol
It also reminds me to be on the lookout for the celebrity that's going to get hit by the IRS come January...who'se it gonna be?!
I'm thinking I should put the TurboTax mailer under the tree to remind me of my 'duty' right after the holidays. :P
I just got a big, cardboard TurboTax mailer containing a CD with the Deluxe edition of TurboTax that U install and pay for online.
The last thing you want to do to a memorable brand is to gut it.
Speaking of 'simplicity', 'consistency' and 'control' from that PC world article, it's so easy to apply those principles to the isded case.
I read it upside down, "isdead"....if you turn pepsi upside down it looks like "isded"....the font they use for the new look doesn't help.
What is UP with Pepsi's new image? the logo is atrocious and that typeface is simply awful. It's difficult to orient the type and at first..
Speaking of which, I saw a bottle of Pepsi the other day and thought when did cosmetics turn dark liquid and come in a beverage bottle?
If you create "Desire" in your audience while giving them a sense of "Control", you've got a winner. This = same formula 4 World of Warcraft
The 2 key factors that separate Apple products from Microsoft products are 1) Elegance and 2) Simplicity, leading to 1) Desire & 2) Control.
There are many more instances of the user feeling a lack of control under Vista than there are in Windows XP, degrading the Vista xperience.
I like the metaphor the author uses for the feeling of 'control'. 4 example, 1 of the biggest Vista mistakes is in how it treats the user.
That type of balance is hard to achieve, but it also goes to show what little attention most developers pay to the human/psych/emotional.
It's really about achieving the fine line between the creative and engineering minds that must come together in order to build something.
It's one of those rare articles you run across in a "computer magazine" and deals w/a very important issue common to product/software design
I've been on a self-imposed 'holiday Twitter break' but had to log in to tweet this article: http://twurl.nl/ret6hl
http://twurl.nl/8t0l7v BLIND = the best World of Warcraft inspired anime/machinima I've ever seen....must check it out if not already seen.
Hope you're enjoying the holidays. I had a wonderful Xmas and am looking forward to spending New Year's Eve at home. Best place 2 be. :)
Lack of oversight allows banks to destroy the economy, and so they are bailed out without any oversight. Someone knows what they R doing.
